00037 
00038 Perceptron::Perceptron(int newNumberOfInputs)
00039 {
00040    // Set synaptic weights
00041 
00042    activationFunction = HyperbolicTangent;
00043 
00044    numberOfInputs = newNumberOfInputs;
00045 
00046    synapticWeights.setSize(numberOfInputs);
00047 
00048    // Init bias and synaptic weights at random 
00049    
00050    initBiasNormal(0.0, 1.0);
00051    initSynapticWeightsNormal(0.0, 1.0);
00052    
00053    display = true;
00054 }
00055

00066 
00067 Perceptron::Perceptron(void)
00068 {
00069    activationFunction = HyperbolicTangent;
00070 
00071    numberOfInputs = 0;
00072 
00073    bias = 0.0;
00074    
00075    display = true;
00076 }

00135 // double getSingleSynapticWeight(int) method
00136 
00143  
00144 double Perceptron::getSingleSynapticWeight(int i)
00145 {
00146    // Control sentence (if debug)
00147 
00148    #ifndef NDEBUG 
00149 
00150    if(i >= numberOfInputs)
00151    {
00152       std::cerr << std::endl 
00153                 << "Flood Error: Perceptron class." << std::endl
00154                 << "double getSingleSynapticWeight(int) method." << std::endl
00155                 << "Index must be less than number of inputs." << std::endl
00156                 << std::endl;
00157 
00158       exit(1);
00159    }
00160 
00161    #endif
00162 
00163    // Get single synaptic weights
00164 
00165    return(synapticWeights[i]);   
00166 }

00207 // void setSynapticWeights(Vector<double>) method
00208 
00215  
00216 void Perceptron::setSynapticWeights(Vector<double> newSynapticWeights)
00217 {
00218    // Control sentence (if debug)
00219 
00220    #ifndef NDEBUG 
00221 
00222    if(newSynapticWeights.getSize() != numberOfInputs)
00223    {
00224       std::cerr << std::endl 
00225                 << "Flood Error: Perceptron class." << std::endl
00226                 << "void setSynapticWeights(Vector<double>) method." << std::endl
00227                 << "Size of synaptic weights vector must be equal to number of inputs." << std::endl
00228                 << std::endl;
00229 
00230       exit(1);
00231    }
00232 
00233    #endif
00234 
00235    // Set synaptic weights
00236    
00237    synapticWeights = newSynapticWeights;
00238 }

00250 
00251 void Perceptron::setSingleSynapticWeight(int i, double newSynapticWeight)
00252 {
00253    // Control sentence (if debug)
00254 
00255    #ifndef NDEBUG 
00256 
00257    if(i >= numberOfInputs)
00258    {
00259       std::cerr << std::endl 
00260                 << "Flood Error: Perceptron class." << std::endl
00261                 << "void setSingleSynapticWeight(int, double) method." << std::endl
00262                 << "Index must be less than number of inputs." << std::endl
00263                 << std::endl;
00264 
00265       exit(1);
00266    }
00267 
00268    #endif
00269 
00270    // Set single synaptic weight
00271 
00272    synapticWeights[i] = newSynapticWeight;
00273 }

00290 // void setNumberOfInputs(int) method
00291 
00297  
00298 void Perceptron::setNumberOfInputs(int newNumberOfInputs)
00299 {
00300    numberOfInputs = newNumberOfInputs;
00301 
00302    synapticWeights.setSize(numberOfInputs);
00303 
00304    // Init bias and synaptic weights at random 
00305 
00306    initBiasNormal(0.0,1.0);
00307    initSynapticWeightsNormal(0.0,1.0);
00308 }

00311 // int getNumberOfNeuronParameters(void) method
00312 
00313 int Perceptron::getNumberOfNeuronParameters(void)
00314 {
00315    int numberOfNeuronParameters = 1 + numberOfInputs;
00316 
00317    return(numberOfNeuronParameters);
00318 }
00319 
00320 
00321 // Vector<double> getNeuronParameters(void) method
00322 
00323 Vector<double> Perceptron::getNeuronParameters(void)
00324 {
00325    int numberOfNeuronParameters = getNumberOfNeuronParameters();
00326 
00327    Vector<double> neuronParameters(numberOfNeuronParameters);
00328 
00329    neuronParameters[0] = bias;
00330 
00331    for(int i = 0; i < numberOfInputs; i++)
00332    {
00333       neuronParameters[1+i] = synapticWeights[i];
00334    }
00335 
00336    return(neuronParameters); 
00337 }
00338 
00339 
00340 // void setNeuronParameters(Vector<double>) method
00341 
00342 void Perceptron::setNeuronParameters(Vector<double> newNeuronParameters)
00343 {
00344    bias = newNeuronParameters[0];
00345 
00346    for(int i = 0; i < numberOfInputs; i++)
00347    {
00348       synapticWeights[i] = newNeuronParameters[i+1];
00349    }
00350 }

00353 // void initBiasUniform(double, double) method
00354 
00363 
00364 void Perceptron::initBiasUniform(double minimumValue, double maximumValue)
00365 {
00366    // Control sentence (if debug)
00367 
00368    #ifndef NDEBUG 
00369 
00370    if(minimumValue > maximumValue)
00371    {
00372       std::cerr << std::endl
00373                 << "Flood Error: Perceptron class." << std::endl 
00374                 << "initBiasAtRandom(double, double) method." << std::endl
00375                 << "Minimum value must be less than maximum value." << std::endl
00376                 << std::endl;
00377 
00378       exit(1);
00379    }
00380 
00381    #endif
00382 
00383    double random = (double)rand()/(RAND_MAX+1.0);
00384 
00385    bias = minimumValue + (maximumValue-minimumValue)*random;
00386 }
00387 
00388 
00389 // void initSynapticWeightsUniform(double, double) method
00390 
00399 
00400 void Perceptron::initSynapticWeightsUniform(double minimumValue, double maximumValue)
00401 {
00402    // Control sentence (if debug)
00403 
00404    #ifndef NDEBUG 
00405 
00406    if(minimumValue > maximumValue)
00407    {
00408       std::cerr << std::endl
00409                 << "Flood Error: Perceptron class." << std::endl 
00410                 << "initSynapticWeightsAtRandom(double, double) method." << std::endl
00411                 << "Minimum value must be less than maximum value." << std::endl
00412                 << std::endl;
00413 
00414       exit(1);
00415    }
00416 
00417    #endif
00418 
00419    // Init synaptic weights
00420 
00421    for(int i = 0; i < numberOfInputs; i++)
00422    {
00423       double random = (double)rand()/(RAND_MAX+1.0);
00424 
00425       synapticWeights[i] = minimumValue + (maximumValue-minimumValue)*random;
00426    }
00427 }
00428 
00429 
00430 // void initBiasNormal(double, double) method
00431 
00440 
00441 void Perceptron::initBiasNormal(double mean, double standardDeviation)
00442 {
00443    // Control sentence (if debug)
00444 
00445    #ifndef NDEBUG 
00446 
00447    if(standardDeviation < 0.0)
00448    {
00449       std::cerr << std::endl
00450                 << "Flood Error: Perceptron class." << std::endl 
00451                 << "initBiasNormal(double, double) method." << std::endl
00452                 << "Standard deviation must be equal or greater than zero." << std::endl
00453                 << std::endl;
00454 
00455       exit(1);
00456    }
00457 
00458    #endif
00459 
00460    double pi = 4.0*atan(1.0);
00461 
00462    double random1 = (double)rand()/(RAND_MAX+1.0);
00463    double random2 = (double)rand()/(RAND_MAX+1.0);
00464 
00465    // Box-Muller transformation
00466 
00467    bias = mean + sqrt(-2.0*log(random1))*sin(2.0*pi*random2)*standardDeviation;
00468 }
00469 
00470 
00471 // void initSynapticWeightsNormal(double, double) method
00472 
00481 
00482 void Perceptron::initSynapticWeightsNormal(double mean, double standardDeviation)
00483 {
00484    // Control sentence (if debug)
00485 
00486    #ifndef NDEBUG 
00487 
00488    if(standardDeviation < 0.0)
00489    {
00490       std::cerr << std::endl
00491                 << "Flood Error: Perceptron class." << std::endl 
00492                 << "initSynapticWeightsNormal(double, double) method." << std::endl
00493                 << "Standard deviation must be equal or greater than zero." << std::endl
00494                 << std::endl;
00495 
00496       exit(1);
00497    }
00498 
00499    #endif
00500 
00501    double pi = 4.0*atan(1.0);
00502 
00503    for(int i = 0; i < numberOfInputs; i++)
00504    {
00505       double random1 = (double)rand()/(RAND_MAX+1.0);
00506       double random2 = (double)rand()/(RAND_MAX+1.0);
00507 
00508       // Box-Muller transformation
00509 
00510       double normallyDistributedRandomNumber 
00511       = mean + sqrt(-2.0*log(random1))*sin(2.0*pi*random2)*standardDeviation;
00512 
00513       synapticWeights[i] = normallyDistributedRandomNumber;
00514    }
00515 }

00517 
00518 // double calculateNetInputSignal(Vector<double>) method
00519 
00524 
00525 double Perceptron::calculateNetInputSignal(Vector<double> inputSignal)
00526 {
00527    // Control sentence (if debug)
00528 
00529    #ifndef NDEBUG 
00530 
00531    if(numberOfInputs == 0)
00532    {
00533       std::cerr << std::endl
00534                 << "Flood Error: Perceptron class." << std::endl 
00535                 << "calculateNetInputSignal(Vector<double>) method." << std::endl
00536                 << "Number of inputs in the neuron must be greater than zero." << std::endl
00537                 << std::endl;
00538 
00539       exit(1);
00540    }
00541    else if(inputSignal.getSize() != numberOfInputs)
00542    {
00543       std::cerr << std::endl
00544                 << "Flood Error: Perceptron class." << std::endl
00545                 << "double calculateNetInputSignal(Vector<double>) method." << std::endl
00546                 << "Size of input signal must be equal to number of inputs." << std::endl
00547                 << std::endl;
00548 
00549       exit(1);
00550    }
00551 
00552    #endif
00553 
00554    // Calculate net input signal
00555 
00556    double netInputSignal = bias + inputSignal.dot(synapticWeights);
00557 
00558    return(netInputSignal);   
00559 }
00560 
00561 
00562 // double calculateOutputSignal(double) method
00563 
00574 
00575 double Perceptron::calculateOutputSignal(double netInputSignal)
00576 {
00577    double outputSignal = 0.0;
00578 
00579    switch(activationFunction)   
00580    {
00581       case Logistic:
00582       {
00583          outputSignal = 1.0/(1.0 + exp(-netInputSignal));
00584       }
00585       break;
00586                                      
00587       case HyperbolicTangent:
00588       {
00589          outputSignal = tanh(netInputSignal);
00590       }
00591       break;
00592 
00593       case Linear:
00594       {
00595          outputSignal = netInputSignal;        
00596       }
00597       break;
00598       
00599       default:
00600          std::cerr << std::endl
00601                    << "Flood Error: Perceptron class." << std::endl 
00602                    << "calculateOutputSignal(Vector<double>) method." << std::endl
00603                    << "Unknown activation function." << std::endl
00604                    << std::endl;
00605 
00606          exit(1);
00607       break;
00608    }
00609 
00610    return(outputSignal);
00611 }
00612 
00613 
00614 // double calculateOutputSignal(Vector<double>) method
00615 
00626 
00627 double Perceptron::calculateOutputSignal(Vector<double> inputSignal)
00628 {
00629    // Control sentence (if debug)
00630 
00631    #ifndef NDEBUG 
00632 
00633    int size = inputSignal.getSize();
00634 
00635    if(size != numberOfInputs)
00636    {
00637       std::cerr << std::endl
00638                 << "Flood Error: Perceptron class." << std::endl 
00639                 << "double calculateOutputSignal(Vector<double>) method." << std::endl
00640                 << "Size must be equal to number of inputs." << std::endl
00641                 << std::endl;
00642 
00643       exit(1);
00644    }
00645 
00646    #endif
00647 
00648    // Calculate output signal
00649 
00650    double netInputSignal = calculateNetInputSignal(inputSignal);
00651 
00652    double outputSignal = calculateOutputSignal(netInputSignal);
00653 
00654    return(outputSignal);  
00655 }
00656 
00657 
00658 // double calculateOutputSignalDerivative(double) method
00659 
00670 
00671 double Perceptron::calculateOutputSignalDerivative(double netInputSignal)
00672 {
00673    double outputSignalDerivative = 0.0;
00674 
00675    switch(activationFunction)   
00676    {
00677       case Logistic:
00678       {
00679          outputSignalDerivative = exp(netInputSignal)/pow(1.0 + exp(netInputSignal), 2);
00680       }
00681       break;
00682                                      
00683       case HyperbolicTangent:
00684       {
00685          outputSignalDerivative = 1.0 - pow(tanh(netInputSignal), 2);
00686       }
00687       break;
00688 
00689       case Linear:
00690       {
00691          outputSignalDerivative = 1.0;
00692       }
00693       break;
00694 
00695       default:
00696          std::cerr << std::endl
00697                    << "Flood Error: Perceptron class." << std::endl 
00698                    << "calculateOutputSignalDerivative(Vector<double>) method." << std::endl
00699                    << "Unknown activation function." << std::endl
00700                    << std::endl;
00701 
00702          exit(1);
00703       break;
00704    }
00705 
00706    return(outputSignalDerivative);
00707 }
00708 
00709 
00710 // double calculateOutputSignalDerivative(Vector<double>) method
00711 
00722 
00723 double Perceptron::calculateOutputSignalDerivative(Vector<double> inputSignal)
00724 {
00725    // Control sentence (if debug)
00726 
00727    #ifndef NDEBUG 
00728 
00729    int size = inputSignal.getSize();
00730 
00731    if(size != numberOfInputs)
00732    {
00733       std::cerr << std::endl
00734                 << "Flood Error: Perceptron class." << std::endl 
00735                 << "double calculateOutputSignalDerivative(Vector<double>) method." << std::endl
00736                 << "Size must be equal to number of inputs." << std::endl
00737                 << std::endl;
00738 
00739       exit(1);
00740    }
00741 
00742    #endif
00743 
00744    // Calculate output signal derivative 
00745 
00746    double netInputSignal = calculateNetInputSignal(inputSignal);
00747 
00748    double outputSignalDerivative = calculateOutputSignalDerivative(netInputSignal);
00749 
00750    return(outputSignalDerivative);
00751 }

00753 
00754 // double calculateOutputSignalSecondDerivative(double) method
00755 
00766 
00767 double Perceptron::calculateOutputSignalSecondDerivative(double netInputSignal)
00768 {
00769    double outputSignalSecondDerivative;
00770 
00771    switch(activationFunction)   
00772    {
00773       case Logistic:
00774       {
00775          outputSignalSecondDerivative 
00776          = -exp(netInputSignal)*(exp(netInputSignal) - 1.0)/pow(exp(netInputSignal + 1), 3);
00777       }
00778       break;
00779                                      
00780       case HyperbolicTangent:
00781       {
00782          outputSignalSecondDerivative = -2.0*tanh(netInputSignal)*(1.0 - pow(tanh(netInputSignal),2));
00783       }
00784       break;
00785 
00786       case Linear:
00787       {
00788          outputSignalSecondDerivative = 0.0;        
00789       }
00790       break;
00791 
00792       default:
00793          std::cerr << std::endl
00794                    << "Flood Error: Perceptron class." << std::endl 
00795                    << "calculateOutputSignalSecondDerivative(Vector<double>) method." << std::endl
00796                    << "Unknown activation function." << std::endl
00797                    << std::endl;
00798 
00799          exit(1);
00800       break;
00801    }
00802 
00803    return(outputSignalSecondDerivative);
00804 }
00805

00807 // double calculateOutputSignalSecondDerivative(Vector<double>) method
00808 
00819 
00820 double Perceptron::calculateOutputSignalSecondDerivative(Vector<double> inputSignal)
00821 {
00822    // Control sentence (if debug)
00823 
00824    #ifndef NDEBUG 
00825 
00826    int size = inputSignal.getSize();
00827 
00828    if(size != numberOfInputs)
00829    {
00830       std::cerr << std::endl
00831                 << "Flood Error: Perceptron class." << std::endl 
00832                 << "double calculateOutputSignalSecondDerivative(Vector<double>) method." << std::endl
00833                 << "Size must be equal to number of inputs." << std::endl
00834                 << std::endl;
00835 
00836       exit(1);
00837    }
00838 
00839    #endif
00840 
00841    // Calculate output signal second derivative
00842 
00843    double netInputSignal = calculateNetInputSignal(inputSignal);
00844 
00845    double outputSignalSecondDerivative = calculateOutputSignalSecondDerivative(netInputSignal);
00846 
00847    return(outputSignalSecondDerivative);
00848 }

00851 // void print(void) method
00852 
00855 
00856 void Perceptron::print(void)
00857 {
00858     // Print header
00859 
00860    std::cout << std::endl
00861              << "Flood Neural Network. Perceptron Object." << std::endl;
00862 
00863    // Print number of inputs
00864 
00865    std::cout << "Number of inputs: " << std::endl
00866              << numberOfInputs << std::endl;
00867 
00868 
00869    // Print activation function
00870 
00871    std::cout << "Activation function:" << std::endl;
00872 
00873    switch(activationFunction)
00874    {
00875       case Logistic:   
00876       {
00877          std::cout << "Logistic" << std::endl;
00878       }
00879       break;
00880 
00881       case HyperbolicTangent:   
00882       {
00883          std::cout << "Hyperbolic tangent" << std::endl;
00884       }
00885       break;
00886 
00887       case Linear:   
00888       {
00889          std::cout << "Linear" << std::endl;
00890       }
00891       break;
00892 
00893       default:
00894          std::cerr << std::endl
00895                    << "Flood Error: Perceptron class." << std::endl 
00896                    << "void print(void) method." << std::endl
00897                    << "Unknown activation function." << std::endl
00898                    << std::endl;
00899 
00900          exit(1);
00901       break;
00902 
00903    }
00904 
00905    // Print bias
00906 
00907    std::cout << "Bias: " << std::endl
00908              << bias << std::endl;
00909 
00910    // Print synaptic weights
00911 
00912    std::cout << "Synaptic weights: " << std::endl
00913              << synapticWeights << std::endl;   
00914 
00915 }
